course.title: Topics in Music from 1600-1800: Proseminar
course.description: Haydn and Mozart. This course explores the lives and music of Joseph Haydn and Wolfgang Amade Mozart, two composers who led powerfully contrasting but intertwined lives. We will study in depth the major genres of Enlightenment-era music in terms of style, structure, technique, and aesthetics. This course also covers the intellectual and social contexts in which Haydn and Mozart worked and the importance of their music within Enlightenment society.
course.notes: For music concentrators or with permission of instructor.
